byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Nairobi, and Jada F. Smith from Washington.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JADA F. SMITH

abstract: Obama administration announces series of regulations aimed at curbing endangered wildlife poaching in Africa; announcement comes as Obama opens visit to Kenya, which relies on survival of endangered species to support its tourism industry; United States is world's second largest consumer of poached ivory.
lead_paragraph: Adding to existing federal laws, the rule changes announced on Saturday would amount to a near total ban on the commercial trade of African elephant ivory in the United States.

headline.main: Obama Administration Targets Trade in African Elephant Ivory
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Targets Trade in African Elephant Ivory

snippet: Adding to existing federal laws, the rule changes announced on Saturday would amount to a near total ban on the commercial trade of African elephant ivory in the United States.
